org.svvrl.goal.core.aut

Class Morphism

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.Morphism

  • public class Morphism
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides methods for checking homomorphism and isomorphism between two automata.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

      • isIsomorphism

        public static boolean isIsomorphism(Automaton aut1,
                                    Automaton aut2)
        Returns true if the first automaton is isomorphic to the second automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        aut2 - an automaton
        Returns:
        true if the first automaton is isomorphic to the second automaton

      • getIsomorphism

        public static java.util.Map<State,State> getIsomorphism(Automaton aut1,
                                                        Automaton aut2)
        Returns an isomorphism between two automata. The isomorphism is represented by a map r : S1 &rarr; S2 where S1 is the state set of the first automaton, S2 is the state set of the second automaton, and r(s1) = s2 if and only if the isomorphism maps s1 to s2. Note that the two automata are required to have the same automaton type, alphabet type, alphabet, and label position.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        aut2 - an automaton
        Returns:
        an isomorphism between the two automata, or null if there is no isomorphism between the two automata

      • isHomomorphism

        public static boolean isHomomorphism(Automaton aut1,
                                     Automaton aut2)
        Returns true if the first automaton is homomorphic to the second automaton.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        aut2 - an automaton
        Returns:
        true if the first automaton is homomorphic to the second automaton

      • getHomomorphism

        public static java.util.Map<State,State> getHomomorphism(Automaton aut1,
                                                         Automaton aut2)
        Returns a homomorphism from one automaton to another automaton. The homomorphism is represented by a map m : S1 &rarr; S2 where S1 is the state set of the first automaton, S2 is the state set of the second automaton, and m(s1) = s2) if and only if the homomorphism maps s1 to s2. Note that the two automata are required to have the same automaton type, alphabet type, alphabet, and label position.
        Parameters:
        aut1 - an automaton
        aut2 - an automaton
        Returns:
        a homomorphism from the first automaton to the second automaton
